Thank you for taking the time to participate in this survey.

Please visit our website for more information

sectionInfo.text: RESPONDENT INFORMATION
INTRODUCTION
Please look at the map below. The red area represents the city footprint in 2010.

SECTION 1: HOUSING TYPES AND THEIR SHARE IN THE OVERALL SUPPLY OF HOUSING IN THE CITY OR METROPOLITAN AREA

View Map

question.text: Share of this type of dwelling in total housing market in the city (excluding institutional housing)

subQuestion.text: 1.1 Estimated share of dwellings in the formal sector that are public housing
1.2 Estimated share of dwellings in the formal sector that are private housing
1.3 Estimated share of private housing units that is in multi-family dwellings
1.4 Estimated share of private housing units that are in single-family homes
1.5 Estimated share of dwellings in the formal sector
1.6 Estimated share of dwellings in the informal sector (slums and squatter settlements)

question.text: Dwelling Unit or Plot Type Available for Sale (Values in local currency)

subQuestion.text: 1.10 Dwelling unit in the informal sector (slums and squatter settlements)
1.11 Plot in fully-serviced formal land subdivision

free.label: Minimum price per square meter on the urban periphery

question.text: Dwelling Unit or Plot Type Available for Rent

subQuestion.text: 1.17 Dwelling unit in the informal sector

free.label: Minimum rent per square meter on the urban periphery

sectionInfo.text: SECTION 6: PLOTS IN FORMAL RESIDENTIAL LAND SUBDIVISIONS OFFERED FOR SALE (OR LONG LEASE)

Note: "Formal" means that such subdivisions satisfy zoning and land subdivision regulations

and offer official land sale (or long lease) documents.

View Map
Features and Attributes

subQuestion.text: 6.1 Of plots with municipal water Supply
6.2 Of plots connected to municipal sewerage network
6.3 Of plots with water supply from wells
6.4 Of plots with paved road in front of building
6.5 Of plots that satisfy municipal land subdivision regulations
6.6 Of plots with legal ownership documents

question.text: 6.11.3 Number of years to repay loan
6.12 Typical house area in these subdivisions (square meters)
6.13 Typical construction cost per square meter

sectionInfo.text: SECTION 7: PLOTS IN INFORMAL RESIDENTIAL LAND SUBDIVISIONS OFFERED FOR SALE (OR LONG LEASE)

Note: "Informal" means that such land subdivisions do not satisfy zoning and land subdivision regulations

but do offer official or semi-official land sale (or long lease) documents.

View Map
Features and Attributes

subQuestion.text: 7.1 Of plots with municipal water supply
7.2 Of plots connected to municipal sewerage network
7.3 Of plots with water supply from wells
7.4 Of plots with paved road in front of building
7.5 Of plots with legal ownership documents

question.text: 7.10.3 Number of years to repay loan
7.11 Typical house area in these subdivisions (square meters)
7.12 Typical construction cost per square meter

sectionInfo.text: SECTION 8: PLOTS IN NEW SQUATTER SETTLEMENTS OFFERED FOR SALE

Note: "Squatter settlements" refer to land subdivisions, formed by the invasion or the illegal occupation of land

without permission and without land documents, that do not satisfy zoning and land subdivision regulations

and do not offer any land documents.

View Map
Features and Attributes

subQuestion.text: 8.1 Of plots with municipal water supply
8.2 Of plots connected to municipal sewerage network
8.3 Of plots with water supply from wells
8.4 Of plots with paved road in front of building
8.5 Of plots with legal ownership documents

question.text: 8.10.3 Number of years to repay loan
8.11 Typical house area in these subdivisions (square meters)
8.12 Typical construction cost per square meter

sectionInfo.text: SECTION 9: ACCESS TO THE CITY CENTER (CITY HALL)

Note: This section seeks to determine how accessible are residential areas that were built recently (1990-2015) to jobs,

assuming that the center of gravity of jobs is City Hall (main municipality or administration building of the central city in the metropolitan area)

View Map
Mode, Time and Cost of Commuting during Rush Hour View Locations
